course.title: Quantitative Analysis of Capital Markets
course.description: An introduction to the analysis of capital markets using quantitative methods. Concepts include risk, expected utility, discounting, binomial-tree valuation methods, martingales, continuous time stochastic calculus methods, stochastic discount factors, financial econometric models and Monte Carlo simulations. These concepts are applied to equities, risk management and derivative pricing.
course.prerequisites: Good quantitative skills including calculus and linear algebra, Statistics 110 or equivalent (i.e. multivariate random variables and conditional distributions), strong interest in finance. Willingness to do some programming.
